title: NMwork - Create Nonmem Parameter Tables
text: table model parameter estimates basic model information. Nevertheless, often cumbersome get decently annotated table parameter estimates. Nonmem control streams, definition parameters ’s, ’s ’s handled $THETA, $OMEGA $SIGMA definition variables CL KIN handled elsewhere, typically $PK, $PRED $ERROR. allows flexibility model definition also leaves book keeping user interpretation parameter estimates. One can choose avoid interpretation parameters outputting variables $TABLE. way, can simulate (often) easily interpretable variable values without relying translation parameters variables. However, interpreting parameter values (preferably including appropriate transformation physiological variables), one can make direct use properties estimated Nonmem parameter precision estimated $COVARIANCE step. vignette presents flexible easy--use framework handling bookkeeping, benefit automated generation annotated parameter tables. Let’s break generation parameter tables four steps. Annotation control streams (user) Compilation annotations, parameter estimates precision, present (tools available NMdata) Formatting parameter table information (NMwork::createParameterTable) Printing parameter table information (NMwork::printParameterTable) Provided step 1. done informatively, step 2 fully wrapped step 3. means, can end simple workflow Model: xgxr134     rest document, see , can get work, can fill information done model development (annotation step 1 ). createParameterTable() printParameterTable() offered NMwork, underlying functionality largely provided NMdata. best experience, make sure keep NMdata date CRAN.
code: file.mod <- system.file("nonmem/xgxr134.mod",package="NMwork") partab <- createParameterTable(file.mod) printParameterTable(partab,format="html")

title: NMwork - Create Nonmem Parameter Tables
text: createParameterTable() uses following columns format parameter table. Hence, large parts document describes techniques fill columns interest createParameterTable(). (characters): symbol: Typically, variable name associated parameter, e.g. “CL”. label: parameter label, e.g. “Clearance”. trans: Parameter transformation (character strings). unit: parameter unit, e.g. “L/h”. panel: Grouping variable. Can intermediary short-hand code like “struct” “iiv”. createParameterTable() use columns formatting, available. Sensible default values used possible. symbol column available, parameter name (.e. THETA(1)) used. default parameter description “label, symbol (unit)” (unit) label /unit missing, resulting parameter description just omit .

title: NMwork - Create Nonmem Parameter Tables
text: seen far relies modeler diligently annotate parameters, text parameter table coming directly control stream. However, may desired edit information. createParameterTable() arguments df.repair .repair . createParameterTable() uses NMdata::mergeCoal() . basic idea non-NA values df.repair inserted (overwriting) parameter table matching columns provided .repair. .repair like merges, mergeCoal() prioritizes df.repair parameter annotations control stream. .repair can character vector length. main limitation approach can use one .repair vector. means need one variable (say symbol) consistently read control stream. merge parameter (like THETA1, OMEGA(1,1) etc.) breaks benefit linking parameters variables control stream.
code: df.repair <- data.frame(symbol="WEIGHTCL",label="Bodyweight effect on clearance") partab <- createParameterTable(file.mod,df.repair=df.repair,by.repair="symbol") |>     printParameterTable(format="html")

title: NMwork - Create Nonmem Parameter Tables
text: Sometimes may need edit table detail df.repair .repair allow . createParameterTable() offers argument df.labs user completely format labels prior table generation. allows say multiple steps mergeCoal manual editing, whatever automated techniques user may . Model: xgxr134     function consider automated detection relationship parameters Nonmem variables (like called symbol ) NMdata::NMrelate(). NMrelate() looks control stream identify variable assignments, shown code column. label column attempt identify name variable parameter associated . works well limitations. instance, THETAs normally work referencing MU defined based parameter, informative parameter name . Also, control stream need create named variables use parameters like THETA ETA directly $DES. hand, always creating named variables, automate step using NMrelate(). example, $OMEGA’s annotated, can use NMrelate fill . parameter sections model look like : Now filled symbol column $OMEGA parameters createParameterTable() can label parameters. parameter table becomes Model: xgxr134b
code: dt.labs <- NMreadParsText(file.mod) df.repair <- data.frame(symbol="WEIGHTCL",label="Bodyweight effect on clearance") dt.labs <- NMwork:::mergeCoal(dt.labs,df.repair,by="symbol",as.fun="data.table") dt.labs[par.type=="OMEGA",label:=paste("IIV:",label)] createParameterTable(file.mod,df.labs=dt.labs) |>     printParameterTable(format="html") NMrelate(file.mod) ;; format: %idx: %symbol ; %label [%unit] ; %trans $THETA  (.1)             ; 1 : TVKA ; Absorption rate [1/h] ; log $THETA  (3)             ; 2 : TVV2 ;  Central volume [L] ; log $THETA  (1)             ; 3 : TVCL ; Clearance [L/h] ; log $THETA  (4)             ; 4 : TVV3 ; Peripheral volume [L] ; log $THETA  (-1)             ; 5 : TVQ ; Intercomparmental clearance [L/h] ; log $THETA .1              ; 6 : AGECL ; Age effect on clearance []; log $THETA .1              ; 7 : WEIGHTCL ; Body-weight effect on clearance []; log $THETA .1              ; 8 : MALECL ; Male effect on clearance []; log $OMEGA 0 FIX  $OMEGA 0.1    $OMEGA 0.1    $OMEGA 0 FIX  $OMEGA 0 FIX  ;; format.sigma: %symbol - %label ; %trans $SIGMA 0.1    ; SigP - Prop err ; propErr $SIGMA 0 FIX  ; SigA - Add err ; addErr df.labs.b <- NMreadParsText(file.mod.b)[par.type!="OMEGA"] |>     rbind(setnames(NMrelate(file.mod.b)[par.type=="OMEGA"],"label","symbol"),fill=TRUE) df.labs.b[,.(par.type,par.name,symbol,label,unit,trans)] createParameterTable(file.lst=file.mod.b,df.labs=df.labs.b) |>     printParameterTable(format="html")

title: NMwork - Create Nonmem Parameter Tables
text: printParameterTable() prints output createParameterTable() using predefined templates. Currently, two templates, first designed display R console, .e. intended interactive use. intended reporting information explicitly expressed. printParameterTable() supports use three “engines” write tables: kable, pmtables, flextable. Switch using engine argument. format argument specifies whether pdf, html Currently, flextable returns flextable object user can save png, docx, pptx, etc.

title: NMwork - Create Nonmem Parameter Tables
text: createParameterTables() already called analysis, code simple. Notice, choose engine="pmtables" use pmtables. pmtables works footnotes even large tables spanning multiple pages. Use engine="kable" get kable stead (course engine="flextable" can used . Depending model (missing) annotations parameter definitions, running createParameterTable() may take little customization, discussed . Therefore, may desired load result step, run printParameterTable(). case
code: createParameterTable(file.mod) |>      printParameterTable(partab,format="latex", engine="pmtables")

what: Gets pairwise data between all columns of data, then provide organizing columns to allow the data to be plotted in a pairwise way in a matrix plot. This function returns the dataset in a format that will be directly used to plot the scatterplot in the lower triangle of the pairs plot. . The output of this function gets sent to NMwork:::EtaPairsScatMat.R (slightly modified version of GGally::scatmat), and then to NMwork::PlotEtaPairs(). Taken with minimal modifications from GGally:::lowertriangle(). — EtaPairsLowerTriangle
title: Gets pairwise data between all columns of data, then provide organizing columns to allow the data to be plotted in a pairwise way in a matrix plot. text: Gets pairwise data columns data, provide organizing columns allow data plotted pairwise way matrix plot. function returns dataset format directly used plot scatterplot lower triangle pairs plot. . output function gets sent NMwork:::EtaPairsScatMat.R (slightly modified version GGally::scatmat), NMwork::PlotEtaPairs(). Taken minimal modifications GGally:::lowertriangle().

title: Gets pairwise data between all columns of data, then provide organizing columns to allow the data to be plotted in a pairwise way in a matrix plot. what: Eta pairs scatterplot matrix lower triangle and diagonal elements. This function takes (1) the time-constant etas dataset, and (2) the output of NMwork:::EtaPairsLowerTriangle() to create the lower triangle and diagonal of the eta pairs plot. The output of this function gets sent to NMwork::PlotEtaPairs(). Taken with minimal modifications from GGally::scatmat(). — EtaPairsScatMat
title: Eta pairs scatterplot matrix lower triangle and diagonal elements. This function takes (1) the time-constant etas dataset, and (2) the output of NMwork:::EtaPairsLowerTriangle() to create the lower triangle and diagonal of the eta pairs plot. The output of this function gets sent to NMwork::PlotEtaPairs(). Taken with minimal modifications from GGally::scatmat(). — EtaPairsScatMat
text: Eta pairs scatterplot matrix lower triangle diagonal elements.  function takes (1) time-constant etas dataset, (2) output NMwork:::EtaPairsLowerTriangle() create lower triangle diagonal eta pairs plot. output function gets sent NMwork::PlotEtaPairs(). Taken minimal modifications GGally::scatmat().

title: Eta pairs scatterplot matrix lower triangle and diagonal elements. This function takes (1) the time-constant etas dataset, and (2) the output of NMwork:::EtaPairsLowerTriangle() to create the lower triangle and diagonal of the eta pairs plot. The output of this function gets sent to NMwork::PlotEtaPairs(). Taken with minimal modifications from GGally::scatmat(). — EtaPairsScatMat
code: EtaPairsScatMat(   data,   columns = 1:ncol(data),   color = NULL,   alpha = 0.6,   shape = 1,   size = 1 )

what: Gets pairwise data between all columns of data, then calculates correlation and p value of correlation to plot in upper triangle of eta pairs plot.. This function returns the dataset in a format that will be directly used to plot the correlation statistics in the upper triangle of the pairs plot. The output of this function gets sent to NMwork::PlotEtaPairs(). This function is taken with minimal modifications from GGally:::uppertriangle(). — EtaPairsUpperTriangle
title: Gets pairwise data between all columns of data, then calculates correlation and p value of correlation to plot in upper triangle of eta pairs plot.. This function returns the dataset in a format that will be directly used to plot the correlation statistics in the upper triangle of the pairs plot. The output of this function gets sent to NMwork::PlotEtaPairs(). This function is taken with minimal modifications from GGally:::uppertriangle(). — EtaPairsUpperTriangle
text: Gets pairwise data columns data, calculates correlation p value correlation plot upper triangle eta pairs plot.. function returns dataset format directly used plot correlation statistics upper triangle pairs plot. output function gets sent NMwork::PlotEtaPairs(). function taken minimal modifications GGally:::uppertriangle().

title: Gets pairwise data between all columns of data, then calculates correlation and p value of correlation to plot in upper triangle of eta pairs plot.. This function returns the dataset in a format that will be directly used to plot the correlation statistics in the upper triangle of the pairs plot. The output of this function gets sent to NMwork::PlotEtaPairs(). This function is taken with minimal modifications from GGally:::uppertriangle(). — EtaPairsUpperTriangle
code: EtaPairsUpperTriangle(   data,   columns = 1:ncol(data),   color = NULL,   corMethod = "pearson" )

FALSE, just get plots. file.mod used, parameter names ETA's associated derived looking $PRED $PK control stream. Essentially, looks ETA's found look parameter name left `=` sign. Alternatively, can hard-code ETA-parameter relationship using regex.eta. fun.file saving plots, function can used translate file names. inputs given function argument "iov_pairs.png" "iov_covs_n.png". script saving plots, stamp add. See ggstamp.

what: Plots Eta pairs scatterplot matrix with lower triangle being a scatterplot, diagonal being a density plot, and upper triangle being text of the correlation and p-value. This function takes (1) the time-constant etas dataset, and (2) the output of NMwork:::EtaPairsUpperTriangle(), (3) the output of NMwork:::EtaPairsScatMat() (and NMwork::EtaPairsLowerTriangle), to plot a full eta pairs matrix plot. Taken with minimal modifications from GGally::ggscatmat(). — PlotEtaPairs
title: Plots Eta pairs scatterplot matrix with lower triangle being a scatterplot, diagonal being a density plot, and upper triangle being text of the correlation and p-value. This function takes (1) the time-constant etas dataset, and (2) the output of NMwork:::EtaPairsUpperTriangle(), (3) the output of NMwork:::EtaPairsScatMat() (and NMwork::EtaPairsLowerTriangle), to plot a full eta pairs matrix plot. Taken with minimal modifications from GGally::ggscatmat(). — PlotEtaPairs
text: Plots Eta pairs scatterplot matrix lower triangle scatterplot, diagonal density plot, upper triangle text correlation p-value.  function takes (1) time-constant etas dataset, (2) output NMwork:::EtaPairsUpperTriangle(), (3) output NMwork:::EtaPairsScatMat() (NMwork::EtaPairsLowerTriangle), plot full eta pairs matrix plot. Taken minimal modifications GGally::ggscatmat().

title: Plots Eta pairs scatterplot matrix with lower triangle being a scatterplot, diagonal being a density plot, and upper triangle being text of the correlation and p-value. This function takes (1) the time-constant etas dataset, and (2) the output of NMwork:::EtaPairsUpperTriangle(), (3) the output of NMwork:::EtaPairsScatMat() (and NMwork::EtaPairsLowerTriangle), to plot a full eta pairs matrix plot. Taken with minimal modifications from GGally::ggscatmat(). — PlotEtaPairs
code: PlotEtaPairs(   data,   columns = 1:ncol(data),   color = NULL,   alpha = 1,   shape = 1,   size = 0.7,   corMethod = "pearson" )

text: file.lst Control stream. possible, recommended use output control stream. can also use input control stream. args.ParsText List arguments passes `NMreadParsText()`. used `df.labs` omitted. df.repair Optional table labels overwrite results `NMreadParsText()`. Useful correct table issues without rerunning model. relevant df.labs omitted, `NMreadParsText()` run `createParameterTable()`. Notice, `df.labs` argument provides full flexibility construct labels running `createParameterTable()`, `dt.labels` solution specific case. `dt.labels` likely re-designed even dropped future. .repair `dt.labels` provided, names columns merge . df.labs optional data.frame parameter labels. provided, source labels columns like units, transformations, etc. drop.symbol Symbol values include. specific, rows values symbol column omitted generated table.

title: Create parameter table data.frame using `NMreadExt()` and `NMreadParsText()` — createParameterTable
text: following columns attempted used may     modified. important user understand     must formatted. many cases, combination args.ParsText df.repair+.repair easy way createParameterTable() work. use NMreadParsText() mergeCoal() repair table. insufficient, labels can read data.frame first passed df.labs. case, tools like NMrelate() can also used. createParameterTable looks uses following columns available: symbol Typically, variable name associated parameter. "CL". label parameter label. "Clearance". trans Parameter transformation (character strings). See possible strings. unit parameter unit. "L/h". panel Blocks parameters types. See options. Adding rse, CI.l, CI.u, corr Descriptive columns generated createParameterTable: tab.est value column shown parameter tables. format depends parameter type transformation. tab.est.ltx latex version tab.est parameter.ltx. latex version parameter name (like theta(1)). case THETA log tranformed, asterisk (*) appended, logit transformed THETAs, two asterisks (**) appended. footnoteing parameter estimates shown physiologigical natural scale. ### Guideline panel column:    ## THETA: struct (default), cov (covariates), RV (residual variability parameters)    ## OMEGA: IIV/BSV (default), IOV/BOV    ## OMEGA diag: (handled automatically)    ## SIGMA: (handled automatically) trans used following: - Transformation: Model parameters (say THETA(1)) values CI scale interpretable parameter, (say CL). - Formatting: Theta's trans equalling addErr propErr gives formatting residual standard deviations additive proportional error terms, respectively. ### trans column:    ## THETA: none (default), log/logTrans, logit, addErr/SD, propErr/CV    ## OMEGA: lognormal (default), normal    ## OMEGA diag: (handled automatically)    ## SIGMA: implemented. ##' THETAs Inverse log (inverse exp) logit (NMcalc::invlogit) applied parameter values confidence intervals. SE RSE calculated backtransformation must interpreted scale estimated THETA, scale transformed parameter (e.g. Clerance CL=EXP(THETA+...). OMEGA's, lognormal distribut CL=EXP(THETA +ETA) , normal additive effects: PAR=EXP(THETA) + ETA. Formatting CV OMEGAs trans="normal" "none": CV=se/est trans="lognormal" : CV=sqrt(exp(OMEGA[,])-1) SIGMA's sorted grouped residual error terms, specific formatting additive, proportional exponential missing. Estimates reported variances correlations. -diagonals OMEGA SIGMA fully automated. automatically identified, labels auto-generated based labels associated diagonal elements. think labeling implemented yet, relatively simple. -diagonal estimates shown correlations. SE standard error variances cov-variances. -diagonal elements, scale estimate (correlation) scale associated uncertainty (covariance) different. Columns created createParameterTable tab.lab proposed descriptive label parameter. Combines label, (structural thetas) symbol unit. panel.label Latex versions (.ltx columns) generated using dplR::latexify. dplR included MPN, need just one function dplR, function copied NMwork instead.

Default TRUE. See `overwrite` . overwrite newfile exists, overwrite ? modify List modification control stream. Passed NMsim:::modifyModel().

title: Create new control stream based on an existing model — newModel
code: ## Reference Base model is run11. You are trying two differnt new ## models run21 and run22. update=TRUE to use final parameter ## estimates as new inits. newmod <- newModel(file.mod="run11.mod",newfile="run21.mod",update=TRUE) #> Error in NMdata:::getLines(file = file.mod, lines = lines, simplify = FALSE): When using the file argument, file has to point to an existing file. ## manual edits of run21.mod. Execute run21.mod ## NMexec(newmod)  # add run22 based on the code in run21 because we need most of the # same edits, so file.mod=run21. But you are testing run22 against # run11, so based.on="run11". Don't update the initial values # based on run21. We want them to be identical to run21, so use # update=FALSE. newmod <- newmodel(file.mod="run21.mod",newfile="run22.mod",based.on="run11.mod",update=FALSE) #> Error in newmodel(file.mod = "run21.mod", newfile = "run22.mod", based.on = "run11.mod",     update = FALSE): could not find function "newmodel"

title: Print parameter table to console, flextable, latex, or (latex) pdf file — printParameterTable
code: file.mod <- system.file("nonmem/xgxr134.mod",package="NMwork") pars <- createParameterTable(file.lst=file.mod,                   args.ParsText=list(format="%idx; %symbol ; %label [%unit] ; %trans",                                      format.sigma="%symbol - %label ")) #> Column(s) added: panel #> Warning: diag(V) had non-positive or NA entries; the non-finite result may be dubious printParameterTable(pars=pars,format="R") #> * parameter was estimated in the log domain and back-transformed for clarity. #> RSE: Relative Standard Error on the scale where the parameter was estimated. #> Model: /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/NMwork/nonmem/xgxr134.lst #>  #>  #> |Parameter  |Label                                   |Est [CV% or Corr%] (RSE%) |95% CI       |Panel    | #> |:----------|:---------------------------------------|:-------------------------|:------------|:--------| #> |THETA(1)   |log, Absorption rate [1/h]              |0.796 (8.0%) (7.9%)               |[1.3,1.7]    |FixedEff | #> |THETA(4)   |log, Peripheral volume [L]              |5.07 (4.8%)               |[4.6,5.6]    |FixedEff | #> |THETA(5)   |log, Intercomparmental clearance [L/h]  |2.13 (2.9%)               |[2,2.3]      |FixedEff | #> |THETA(6)   |log, Age effect on clearance []         |0.341 (42.2%)             |[0.059,0.62] |FixedEff | #> |THETA(7)   |log, Body-weight effect on clearance [] |0.188 (191.6%)            |[-0.52,0.9]  |FixedEff | #> |THETA(8)   |log, Male effect on clearance []        |1.17 (10.4%)              |[0.93,1.4]   |FixedEff | #> |OMEGA(1,1) |                                        |0 (fixed)                 |-            |IIV      | #> |OMEGA(2,2) |                                        |0.178 [44%] (17.8%)       |[0.12,0.24]  |IIV      | #> |OMEGA(3,3) |                                        |0.24 [52%] (18.5%)        |[0.15,0.33]  |IIV      | #> |OMEGA(4,4) |                                        |0 (fixed)                 |-            |IIV      | #> |OMEGA(5,5) |                                        |0 (fixed)                 |-            |IIV      | #> |SIGMA(1,1) |Prop err
